thread.title: Warford out again for Detroit; Lynch, Mebane out for Seattle
thread.title_full: Warford out again for Detroit; Lynch, Mebane out for Seattle

title: Warford out again for Detroit; Lynch, Mebane out for Seattle
text:
Warford out again for Detroit; Lynch, Mebane out for Seattle Posted: Updated: 
SEATTLE (AP) - Detroit right guard Larry Warford is out for Monday night's game against the Seattle Seahawks, a big blow for an already struggling offensive line. 
Warford was questionable with an ankle injury that got worse during the week. It's the second game Warford has missed this season after sitting out Week 1 with the ankle problem. The Lions will start Manny Ramirez at right guard and go with rookie Laken Tomlinson at left guard. 
The Lions are also without defensive leader DeAndre Levy, missing his fourth straight game. Levy was a limited participant in practice this week, but was downgraded to out Sunday. 
Seattle was without Marshawn Lynch and Brandon Mebane, who were ruled out Sunday. It'll be just the second game Lynch has missed since arriving in Seattle. Starting linebacker Bruce Irvin was active despite showing up on the final injury report as questionable with an ankle injury.

More >> Anderson-Dolan Impresses in Season Opener, Leads Chiefs to 6-4 Win Over Americans Jaret Anderson-Dolan scored a hat-trick in the Chiefs season opener, on the way to a 6-4 win. Rookie forward Jaret Anderson-Dolan picked an opportune time to score the first three goals of his young WHL career, netting a hat trick to lead the Spokane Chiefs to a come-from-behind 6-4 win over the rival Tri-City Americans on Saturday Night at Spokane Arena. Forward Hudson Elynuik earned the distinction of scoring the Chiefs' first goal of the 2015-16 regular season, punching in a rebound opportunity just 1:14 into regulation.
